top_categories.workout_context: Racing Collegiate Gravel Nationals isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s texas panhandle gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Collegiate Gravel Nationals rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Collegiate Gravel Nationals — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Collegiate Gravel Nationals — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Collegiate Gravel Nationals when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Collegiate Gravel Nationals. Make this intensity feel like home.
The varied gradients at Collegiate Gravel Nationals reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Collegiate Gravel Nationals — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Collegiate Gravel Nationals requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt to build confidence. Expect: texas panhandle gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%), rolling plains.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, VO2max, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 62 miles of texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt in Turkey, Texas.
